questions.q: He said, “I shall come tomorrow”. (Change into indirect speech).
options: He said that he would come the following day.
He said he would come the following day.
He said that he would come tomorrow.
He said that he will come the following day.
questions.ex: In indirect speech, 'tomorrow' changes to 'the following day' and 'shall' changes to 'would'.

questions.q: He said, “I passed the examination long ago”. (Change into indirect speech).
options: He said I passed the examination.
He said that he had passed the examination long before.
He said he had passed the examination long before.
He asked that he has passed the examination long before.
questions.ex: In indirect speech, the past simple ('passed') changes to the past perfect ('had passed') and 'ago' changes to 'before' or 'earlier'.

questions.q: Hurrah! We have got the prize. Which kind of sentence is this?

questions.q: She said, “Is this your book?” (Change into indirect speech).
options: She asked if that was her book.
She asked if that was my book.
She asked if this was her book.
She asked if this was his book.
questions.ex: In indirect speech, 'this' can change to 'that', and 'your' changes based on who 'she' is talking to (assumed to be 'me' in this context, thus 'my').

questions.q: Six men earn as much as 7 women, 2 women as much as 3 boys and 4 boys as much as 5 girls. If a girl earns Rs.400.00 a week what does a man earn in a day.
questions.ex: This requires a step-by-step calculation based on the ratios of earnings. Assuming a 7-day week for daily earning calculation: 5 girls = 4 boys, so 1 boy = 5/4 girls. If a girl earns Rs.400/week, a boy earns (5/4)*400 = Rs.500/week. 2 women = 3 boys, so 1 woman = 3/2 boys. A woman earns (3/2)*500 = Rs.750/week. 6 men = 7 women, so 1 man = 7/6 women. A man earns (7/6)*750 = Rs.875/week. Daily earning for a man (assuming 7 days) = 875/7 = Rs.125/day. The options seem to be based on daily earnings. If a girl earns Rs.400/week, let's assume this is for a certain number of working days. The relationships are given in terms of earning capacity over the same period (implied). Let's calculate daily earnings assuming a 7-day week. Girl's daily earning = 400/7. 4 boys earn as much as 5 girls, so 4 * (Boy's daily earning) = 5 * (400/7). Boy's daily earning = (5/4) * (400/7) = 500/7. 2 women earn as much as 3 boys, so 2 * (Woman's daily earning) = 3 * (500/7). Woman's daily earning = (3/2) * (500/7) = 750/7. 6 men earn as much as 7 women, so 6 * (Man's daily earning) = 7 * (750/7). 6 * (Man's daily earning) = 750. Man's daily earning = 750/6 = Rs. 125.00.
